intro: Stylidium turbinatum, commonly known as the Turban Sticklily, is a unique member of the genus Stylidium within the family Haemodoraceae. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color, which are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. The plant produces a distinctive, elongated seed capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Stylidium turbinatum is native to Australia and is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
